From la traveled to Lebanon ... to ... this is Lincoln radio journal on this edition surging Trump economy has created a new problem for employers they can't find enough qualified people to fill open jobs
David Taylor of the Pennsylvania Manufacturers Association is here to lead a capital watch look at results of the fall two thousand and Eighteen Keystone business climate survey
And Democrats are putting politics over principle this election year tilting socialist in urban districts and more mainstream in rural and suburban one
Doctor ... from the center for vision and values that grow City College has
A Lincoln radio journal commentary [noise]
I'm looming Henry and welcome to Lincoln radio journal we'll get to our capital watch through in just a couple of minutes but first we have news headlines from PA town hall dot com [noise]
Pennsylvania's fourteen state universities consistently raised tuition and lobbied the state legislature for more money
But all those dollars are going to educate fewer and fewer students enrollment at the university's has fallen for the eighth consecutive year do under one hundred thousand total students that is the lowest enrollment level since two thousand and one
State system has been on a spending bans constructing new buildings and has failed to contained labor and administrative costs
Those factors appear to be pricing the university's out of the marketplace with some prospective student's
A recent study commissioned by the Pennsylvania Senate recommends merging some of the smaller universities with larger ones to improve the efficiency those recommendations will be reviewed by the systems new chancellor damn Greenstein
State budget is expected to be tied again next year so chances of significant additional state subsidies appear to be slim even assuming that is a good idea for taxpayer dollars to prop up an antiquated and failing business model
Looking for a job while there appears to be no shortage of employment opportunities these days a recent survey by the job recruiting ... glass door found Ninety two thousand job openings in the Pittsburgh region
The survey deemed to Pittsburgh the number one location in the nation for job hunters Philadelphia came in Eighteenth in the survey not only our jobs plentiful in western Pennsylvania but workers expressed a higher degree of satisfaction with their jobs than in other cities across the country
Speaking of jobs are those are the Pennsylvania legislature are more secure as an effort to cut the size of the state house and the state Senate failed to happen as the two thousand Seventeen Eighteen legislative seasoned effectively came to a close this past week
Proposed constitutional amendment to reduce the house from two hundred and three to one hundred and fifty one members and cut the Senate from fifty to twenty eight members died due to differences of opinion between the two chambers
There was a board in the house for reducing the size of both the house and the Senate but senators rejected cutting their own members opting to approve only a reduction in the lower chamber
Sense of differences could not be reconciled the entire effort failed and it has been a rough week for lawmakers as to state representatives have passed away first came news that state representative Mike O'Brien of Philadelphia had died he was not seeking reelection due to health concerns
And Scranton area lawmaker said ...
Unexpectedly passed away from complications following heart surgery lawmakers were highly popular with colleagues from both sides of the aisle really tribute to their public service followed word of they're passing read about all things Pennsylvania on be a town hall dot com
